trans-unit.source: Paints an area with cached content.
Use the BitmapCacheBrush class to reuse a cached element efficiently.
This is useful when you need to paint complex content onto multiple elements.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache> class to cache a complex element.

Assign a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> property and optionally assign a <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CacheMode> of the brush and the target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> interact to produce different behaviors.
The following table describes this interaction.

||Target has no CacheMode|Target has CacheMode| |-|-----------------------------|--------------------------| |Brush has no CacheMode|Target visual renders normally; brush uses default cache behavior.|Target visual renders into its own cache; brush uses targetâ€™s cache when rendering.| |Brush has CacheMode|Target visual renders normally; brush renders target into its own cache and uses this to render.|Target visual renders into its own cache; brush renders target into brush's own cache and uses this to render.| The BitmapCacheBrush class is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> class, but BitmapCacheBrush always renders from a cache on the target element, or from a cache defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
The BitmapCacheBrush class also supports dirty regions.
The following table shows the default bitmap cache settings for the BitmapCacheBrush class.

|Bitmap Cache Property|Default Setting| |---------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.SnapsToDevicePixels%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.EnableClearType%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.RenderAtScale%2A>|1| The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.SnapsToDevicePixels%2A> property is ignored by the BitmapCacheBrush class.
The BitmapCacheBrush class ignores the following properties on the root <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>.
This behavior differs from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> class.

- <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualOffset%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualTransform%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualClip%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualEffect%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualOpacity%2A> - <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual.VisualOpacityMask%2A>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to cache and use as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target*>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether layout is applied to the contents of this brush.

When the AutoLayoutContent property is `true`, layout is applied to the contents of the brush if <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> is a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> with no parent.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if layout is applied; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.AutoLayoutContent*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CacheMode"></xref> that represents cached content.
The BitmapCache property interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> property.
For a table that shows this interaction, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class overview.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache"></xref> that represents cached content.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref>, making deep copies of the object's values.
When copying the object's dependency properties, this method copies expressions (which might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone (deep copy) of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> using its current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets the target visual to cache.
The Target property interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
For a table that shows this interaction, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class overview.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to cache and paint with.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target*> dependency property.
To be added.
